answers.answer: I would seek another opinion.  This sounds too serious not to pursue.  Good luck and God Bless you.

question: I am only 25 female, but with family history of abdominal cancer (not sure of the exact location), diabetes, heart failure, high blood pressure.  I have been having dark bloody stools 3 days in row, loss of appetite for more than two weeks, and short pain sensations in different parts of my organs and bones (nothing painful really, but I feel something is going on there), ocassional feet edema (this happened way before my black stool by months, and is extreme often times), dark circles under the eye, eye redness (now I even have a constant red/yellowish spot in the whiteness), and often times I had orange urine.  My stool later on was coming in different shapes, I had it mushy with dark school and few other times.  They day I had black stool, I went to hospital and they made rectal exam and confirmed that it was blood.   They asked referred me to a specialist in gastronomy and colon.  My blood test with fine in terms of protein, and today.  In the last few days, I did both Gastroscopy and Colonoscopy. Negative result for both and everything was normal.  The doctor did take a biopsy and I am waiting to hear back.  All the symptoms lister earlier all started together after the black stool for a week and half or so then it stopped, now I don't have any of these anymore except for loss of appetite.I don't have any sort of abdominal pain, sometimes I get sensations in the flanks and other areas as I mentioned earlier.  I also started having back pains, but only for few times.Yesterday after the Colonoscopy, the doctor did not write any further actions or recommendations.What should I do now? Am I really fine?
title: Dark Bloody Stool, Negative Colonoscopy and Gastroscopy.
